column4: I'm setting up a dual boot of XP Home and 10.04LTS.  Any reason I should create a partion for XP when I put it on?  Or, should I just let it do it's thing and wait to partition when I add Ubuntu?
Do you have a drive 'map' for the partitions on paper or in your head?
I suppose I only need about 10% of the drive.  Is it better to start with a partition for XP, knowing that?
